meanings.sent1: The author shared the manuscript with a few trusted friends prepublication.
meanings.sent2: The book was sent to reviewers for feedback prepublication.
meanings.sent3: The librarian jokingly said, 'I'll read the book prepublication and spoil the ending for you!'
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the air was palpable, like a prepublication storm brewing before the book launch.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation before the official release was heightened by the prepublication buzz.

meanings.definition: The act of publishing something before it is officially released.
meanings.sent1: The prepublication of the research findings caused a stir in the scientific community.
meanings.sent2: The company decided on a prepublication strategy to build interest in the new product.
meanings.sent3: The prepublication of the magazine issue was a strategic move to attract more subscribers.
meanings.sent4: The prepublication of the report was like a sneak peek into the future of the industry.
meanings.sent5: The prepublication of the novel created a buzz among eager readers.
